channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump admitted to concealing the deadly threat of coronavirus, new book reveals
Trump kept how deadly coronavirus was from his campaign, source says
Trump tapes: President told Woodward what he held back from America on Covid-19
item.description: In newly released audio, President Trump told journalist Bob Woodward in February that Covid-19 was airborne and deadly. CNN's Jamie Gangel reports.

item.title: The UK government is threatening to break the law. It could backfire badly
item.description: Britain's internal battle over Brexit has reached a new low.

item.title: Barr tries to blame politics for reaction to DOJ paying for Trump's defense in defamation lawsuit
item.description: Attorney General William Barr on Wednesday defended the Justice Department's decision to represent President Donald Trump in a defamation lawsuit filed by a woman who has accused Trump of sexual assault in the 1990s.

item.title: 4 insane things just happened to Tesla
item.description: We're barely a week into September and it's already been a wild month for Tesla.

item.title: Wildfires are ravaging the entire US West Coast
item.description: About 40 large fires are ravaging the three contiguous West Coast states, and Oregon's governor says some situations have been dire enough to make even firefighters retreat.

item.title: 'Doomsday glacier' could increase sea levels 25 inches -- and it's melting fast
item.description: Deep channels discovered under the Antarctic's so-called "Doomsday glacier" may be allowing warm ocean water to melt the underside of ice, according to scientists collecting data from an area crucial to understanding sea-level rise.

item.title: Drone footage shows unrelenting floods in Sudan
item.description: Sudan has been hit by unrelenting floods as the government says the level of water is the "highest" for a century. CNN's Nima Elbagir reports.

item.title: Fire 'destroys' Europe's largest migrant camp
item.description: Europe's largest migrant camp, Moria, has been "completely destroyed" after massive fires broke out early Wednesday at the overcrowded site on Greece's Lesbos island, according to an eyewitness.

item.title: Oxford vaccine trial paused after unexplained illness in volunteer
Police chief refuses to reinstate officer who was fired over racist text messages
item.description: The Manchester Police Department in New Hampshire is at odds with an officer they fired in 2018 after a labor arbitrator ruled they must rehire him.

item.title: The West looks on in anger -- but there's little it can do to change things in Belarus
item.description: One by one, the leaders of the protest movement in Belarus are being taken out of circulation. One of them is reportedly in prison after apparently being detained early Wednesday. Several others have been unceremoniously dumped at the country's borders and are now in exile.

item.title: Taiwan appears determined to create an anti-Beijing alliance as Chinese state media warns of potential sanctions against US
item.description: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen wants to create an alliance to defend "freedom, safety, human rights and democracy" in Asia, as the self-ruled island faces renewed pressure from neighboring China.

item.title: Sporting officials (and Trump) urge Iran not to execute champion wrestler
item.description: The World Players Association (WPA) has called for the head of the Iranian judiciary to grant an immediate stay of execution to Iranian champion wrestler Navid Afkari, who faces the death penalty.

item.title: Convicted murderer on death row sworn in by Sri Lankan parliament
item.description: A convicted murderer on death row was sworn in as a Sri Lankan lawmaker Tuesday, after a court ruled that he could not be barred from the country's 225-member Parliament.

item.title: Trump holds rally with few people wearing masks
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta comment on President Donald Trump holding a campaign rally in North Carolina with few people wearing masks, despite the state's mask requirement.

item.title: Donald Trump is a lot less rich today than when he was elected president
item.description: President Donald Trump said in October 2019 that being president is costing him money. Lots of it.

item.title: Netherlands records highest daily Covid-19 infections in months
An 80-year-old who disappeared while out hiking turned up at his own missing person appeal
item.description: An 80-year-old man who went missing while hiking during a hailstorm was reunited with his family at a press conference staged to try and find him.

item.title: Strong winds topple more than 45 semitrucks in 1 day
item.description: Some Utah highways turned dangerous when extremely strong winds caused at least 45 semitrucks to topple within one day. At least four drivers had to receive medical treatment.

item.title: US lawmakers want to stop calling Xi Jinping a President. But will he care?
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping holds so many titles that he has earned himself a nickname: the "Chairman of Everything."

item.title: 'False!' Keilar calls out Trump on his lies from past 24 hours
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks President Trump's falsehoods from the past 24 hours.

item.title: Robot dogs join high-tech US Air Force exercise
item.description: It looked like a scene from science fiction.

item.title: Caster Semenya loses appeal in Swiss court over restriction of testosterone levels
item.description: Two-time Olympic champion Caster Semenya has lost an appeal against the restriction of testosterone in female athletes, it was announced Tuesday.

item.title: Trade fight dooms LVMH's $16 billion Tiffany deal
item.description: LVMH says the threat of US tariffs on French products has forced it to scrap its planned acquisition of Tiffany, which would have been the biggest luxury goods deal in history.

item.title: Iran court brings new charges against Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, sparking UK outrage
item.description: The British government has condemned an Iranian court's decision to bring new charges against Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the British-Iranian charity worker jailed on espionage charges four years ago.

item.title: Naomi Osaka nearly moved to tears by messages from families of Ahmaud Arbery and Trayvon Martin
item.description: After her win Tuesday night in the quarterfinal match of the US Open, tennis star Naomi Osaka was nearly brought to tears by video messages from the parents of Trayvon Martin and Ahmaud Arbery thanking her for honoring them during the tournament.

item.title: Black jogger detained by police and sheriff who offered him a job talks to Anderson Cooper
item.description: A Black jogger who went on Facebook Live when he was stopped by police joins Anderson Cooper along with the sheriff who later offered him a job. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

item.title: The hidden surprises of Microsoft Flight Simulator
item.description: We'd heard about the new Microsoft Flight Simulator's mega-realistic scenery, digitally distilled from satellite imagery. We knew the sim could recreate real-time weather conditions on the go, relayed from live climatic data feeds. Even real-world pilots say that the look and feel of the airplanes are, in so many ways, indistinguishable from the real thing.

item.title: What Android gets right that the iPhone gets so wrong
item.description: It's hard to find a better smartphone than the iPhone. It's beautiful, it's fast, it's easy to use and as Steve Jobs would say, "It just works." But Android is no slouch, and it gets one crucial feature so right -- and it's a feature that Apple keeps screwing up.

item.title: Why Trump photo infuriated this military widow
item.description: Kait Wyatt, a military widow and veteran, says she recently she saw a 2017 photo of President Donald Trump standing over her husband's tombstone in Arlington National Cemetery and was "instantly furious." The photo resurfaced as the President continues to deny a report that he called fallen military troops "losers" and "suckers."

item.title: For the first time since 2014, men's tennis will have a new grand slam champion
item.description: In a matter of minutes Sunday, this year's US Open men's draw went from a closed book to a vast blank page.

item.title: The Oscars make inclusion a requirement for best picture
item.description: Five years after the #OscarsSoWhite hashtag triggered controversy, the group behind the awards has made inclusion a requirement to be considered to win them.

item.title: 'Life-changing' solar fridge costs $1 a day
item.description: Keeping food fresh without refrigeration is near impossible in the scorching climate of sub-Saharan Africa. But it's hard to power fridges in a region where almost 600 million people live off the grid.

item.title: Because of Covid, these female rangers could never go home
item.description: Packing her bags to go home for the first time in over four months, Maasai ranger Purity Lakara -- who patrols lands in Kenya's Amboseli National Park, known for its free-roaming elephants and views of Mount Kilimanjaro -- is overjoyed to be seeing her family for the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic was declared.

item.title: How Anderson Cooper handles his critics
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper answers viewers questions about what music he likes to listen to at the gym, and what historical figure he would interview if given the chance. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday at 6p E.T.

item.title: David Beckham is taking his esports company public in London IPO
item.description: A company co-founded by David Beckham plans to become the first esports franchise to list on the London Stock Exchange, taking advantage of the growing popularity of online gaming.

item.title: Some of the best moments from 'Keeping up with the Kardashians'
item.description: The end of an era draws close.

item.title: Travis Scott drops McDonald's-themed merchandise, including a $90 chicken nugget pillow
item.description: Travis Scott clearly loves McDonald's -- so much, in fact, that a promotion with the fast food chain wasn't enough. Now he's selling Golden Arches-themed merchandise.

item.title: Parents and other caregivers are more stressed and in poorer health due to pandemic, report finds
item.description: When Raquel Minina's 11-year-old son Syrus came home from school in Paulding County, Georgia, last week with a sore throat, runny nodse and diarrhea, she was devastated.

item.title: How the Kardashian-Jenner family built their business empire
item.description: From the O.J. Simpson trial to brand ambassadors, here's how the Kardashian-Jenner family have maintained their stardom and turned it into a business.

item.title: This young fashion brand is tackling two of fashion's biggest issues head-on
item.description: London-based designer Priya Ahluwalia uses her eponymous fashion label to explore her Indian and Nigerian heritage and tackle fashion's colossal waste problem.

item.title: New Bob Woodward book reveals what the US President really knew about Covid-19
White House tries to dismiss Trump's admission
item.description: The White House insists Donald Trump has "never lied to the American public" about coronavirus after the President gave veteran journalist Bob Woodward a series of interviews where he said the pandemic was deadly while playing it down in public.

item.title: 'Dangerous' and 'unfit': Trump's former national security advisers say he has 'no moral compass' in new Woodward book
item.description: President Donald Trump's former top Cabinet officials are among his harshest critics in journalist Bob Woodard's new book "Rage," providing some of the most brutal assessments of the commander in chief to date: "Dangerous." "Unfit." "No moral compass." "Doesn't know the difference between the truth and a lie."

item.title: Scaramucci on Trump: He'll get annihilated in November
item.description: Former White House Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci responds to Michael Cohen's theory that President Trump may resign if he is not reelected, in order to fulfill certain agendas.

item.title: Analysis: Trump shows again he'll do anything to win
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday went further than ever before in putting the degradation of the rule of law at the center of his reelection campaign.

item.title: US companies sticking with China
item.description: American companies in China are feeling increasingly pessimistic about trade tensions between Washington and Beijing. But very few want to uproot their business in the world's second biggest economy.
